thread.title: Mum let boyfriend beat young son to death - over a piece of missing birthday cake
thread.title_full: Mum let boyfriend beat young son to death - over a piece of missing birthday cake

author: Natalie Evans
title: Mum let boyfriend beat young son to death - over a piece of missing birthday cake
text:
Oriana Garcia, 26, admitted first degree child abuse over the death of her son (Photo: Hagerstown Police) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A cruel mother let her boyfriend beat her young son to death - over a missing piece of birthday cake. 
Oriana Garcia, 26, pleaded guilty to first-degree child abuse over the death of nine-year-old Jack Garcia. 
The tragic youngster was handcuffed to a chair by Garcia's brother, Jacob Barajas, before her boyfriend Robert Wilson started beating him. 
Garcia approved the punishment as she was "trying to teach Jack not to steal," according to Hagerstown Police Detective Shane Blankenship. Read More Killer dad smothered baby son to death in rage 'triggered by smoking cannabis every day' Robert Wilson is serving 30 years for second-degree murder (Photo: Hagerstown Police Department) 
Wilson savagely beat the boy because he thought the youngster had eaten cake meant for his two-year-old daughter. 
Jack was beaten unconscious on June 30 and died in hospital six days later on July 5. Read More Babysitter 'shook baby niece to death because she wouldn't stop crying and refused to eat' Garcia's brother Jacob Barajas is awaiting sentencing for first-degree child abuse (Photo: Hagerstown Police) 
Police say Garcia allowed the abuse to happen and sent an ambulance away as her son lay dying. 
Prosecutors agreed to drop a second-degree murder charge and seek a sentence of no more than 20 years for Garcia, who appeared in a courtroom in Maryland. (Photo: Google) 
Wilson is serving 30 years for second-degree murder . 
Garcia's brother Barajas is awaiting sentencing for first-degree child abuse. Like us on Facebook
